summary: This document is an exhibit list from Chapter 5 of a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General report, detailing 75 exhibits related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in federal custody. The list includes news articles, legal documents, Bureau of Prisons records, FBI interview reports, and internal memoranda concerning events before and after his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose death in custody is under investigation. The exhibits include his last will and testament, psychological assessments, and custody records.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer at MCC New York who was assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Epstein died. She is the subject of a deferred prosecution agreement and multiple interview reports.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A BOP staff member whose digital devices were examined as part of the investigation. A timeline analysis of his desktop property is listed as an exhibit.

connections.description: Noel was a correctional officer responsible for monitoring Epstein in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein Signs Will
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed his last will and testament, rolling his assets into a trust two days before his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document references autopsy reports and incident reports related to his death.

events.title: Prisoner Transfer and Legal Call
events.description: Emails discuss the transfer of prisoners from NYM to GEO, and Epstein had a Special Housing Unit legal call.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreement for Tova Noel
events.description: A deferred prosecution agreement was filed against correctional officer Tova Noel in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York (MCC New York)
Superior Court of the Virgin Islands Division of St. Thomas and St. John
U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York
New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein signed a new will and placed his assets into a trust just two days before his death on August 10, 2019.
The Office of the Inspector General compiled extensive evidence including BOP logs, FBI interviews, surveillance analysis, and an autopsy report to investigate the circumstances of Epstein's death.
Correctional Officer Tova Noel was subject to a deferred prosecution agreement related to the incident.
The investigation involved forensic examination of digital devices belonging to BOP staff, including Michael Thomas.
The document list shows a focus on BOP procedures, staff assignments, and cell checks in the Special Housing Unit during the time of Epstein's death.
